dt: {bc}to create a new {d_link|image|image:1} of (someone or something): such as
{bc}to form a new mental picture of (someone or something)

dt.t: {wi}reimage{/wi} oneself in a more positive light

dt: {bc}to impress a new conception of (something) upon a group of people

dt.t: I covered the Catholic Church's then-new global campaign to {wi}reimage{/wi} {ldquo}evangelizing{rdquo} as being more organic and less judgmental about one's faith.

dt: {bc}to create a new representation of (something, such as a story) {bc}{sx|reimagine||}

dt.t: It is difficult to imagine a finer, more up-to-date {wi}reimaging{/wi} of this curious classic …

dt: {bc}to replace the contents of (a computer or hard drive) with a previously created {d_link|disk image|disk image}

dt.t: … helped the district's IT staff {wi}reimage{/wi} laptops for student use.

shortdef: to create a new image of (someone or something): such as
to form a new mental picture of (someone or something)
to impress a new conception of (something) upon a group of people
